summary: Eric Starvo Galt is an alias used by James Earl Ray, the suspected assassin of Martin Luther King, Jr. CIA cables disseminated information about Galt to multiple locations worldwide, seeking assistance in locating him. The documents indicate that Galt was also known under the aliases Harvey Lowmyer and John Willard. The CIA's involvement in gathering information on Galt was undertaken at the FBI's request, with efforts made to track his aliases and whereabouts through overseas liaison services.
significance: Eric Starvo Galt is significant as one of the aliases used by James Earl Ray, the suspected assassin of Martin Luther King, Jr. The documents highlight the efforts to track Ray under this alias following the assassination.
